dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about Netflix. Reed Hastings, their CEO, he's been making some waves, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about Netflix. Reed Hastings, their C E O, he's been making some waves, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. The article says he's, like, genuinely terrified by the impending competition. He's calling these new rivals "world-class consumer brands."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. The article says he's, like, genuinely terrified by the impending competition. He's calling these new rivals world-class consumer brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Netflix CEO Reed Hastings isnt letting the competition see him sweat. We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's predicting they'll bankrupt consumers and content creators alike! Which is, uh, pretty intense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's predicting they'll bankrupt consumers and content creators alike! Which is, uh, pretty intense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is! Especially when you look at their own numbers. Like, they reported a massive decrease in revenue, down 22%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! Especially when you look at their own numbers. Like, they reported a massive decrease in revenue, down twenty two percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Revenue for the first quarter rose 22% to $4.5 billion, compared with a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And subscribers! We're talking 9.6 million fewer subscribers in just one quarter. [interrupts] A huge chunk of that was in the US, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And subscribers! We're talking nine point six million fewer subscribers in just one quarter. A huge chunk of that was in the U S, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March. Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, like 7.86 million just in the US! But then, get this, they forecast soaring growth for the next quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like seven point eight six million just in the U S! But then, get this, they forecast soaring growth for the next quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S. The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the stock climbed almost five bucks a share because of it. Apparently, they're, uh, lowering rates in the US, which they think will fuel that growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the stock climbed almost five bucks a share because of it. Apparently, they're, uh, lowering rates in the U S, which they think will fuel that growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60. This guidance takes into account the impact Netflix's rate increase in the U.S., which is moderating growth in the spring quarter, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. And then there's Disney, right? Coming out in November with their new service.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. And then there's Disney, right? Coming out in November with their new service.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The forthcoming service debuts in the U.S. on Nov. 12 with a strong roster of entertainment brands, including Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Hastings, get this, he described their roster of brands – like Star Wars, Pixar, Marvel – as "weak."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Hastings, get this, he described their roster of brands - like Star Wars, Pixar, Marvel - as weak.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The forthcoming service debuts in the U.S. on Nov. 12 with a strong roster of entertainment brands, including Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Weak? [chuckles] Come on! That's, um, a bold take. And he also thinks everyone's just gonna flock back to passive linear TV?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Weak? Come on! That's, um, a bold take. And he also thinks everyone's just gonna flock back to passive linear T V?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hastings said all direct-to-consumers services will benefit, as consumers migrate away from passive TV viewing to entertainment delivered online and on-demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He says there's insufficient appetite for great movies and shows, and Netflix barely satisfies a portion of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He says there's insufficient appetite for great movies and shows, and Netflix barely satisfies a portion of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, is interesting because then he also said there's "no competition out there." But then Disney and Apple "add a little bit more."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, is interesting because then he also said there's no competition out there. But then Disney and Apple add a little bit more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres a ton of competition out there, Hastings said in a recorded interview following the earnings release. Disney and apple add a little bit more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A little bit more! Such a casual way to put it. He also mentioned that Netflix is only like, 10% of total TV usage in the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A little bit more! Such a casual way to put it. He also mentioned that Netflix is only like, ten percent of total T V usage in the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted, and there's more room to grow around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's not a huge slice, is it? And it sounds like their original content isn't always hitting either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's not a huge slice, is it? And it sounds like their original content isn't always hitting either.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he highlighted *The Umbrella Academy* did well, but then he also said 52 million homes *avoided* watching *Triple Frontier*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he highlighted The Umbrella Academy did well, but then he also said fifty two million homes avoided watching Triple Frontier.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ouch. Avoided. And they're canceling local shows, too, like *Nailed It! México* because the dubbed US version was, um, three times more popular?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ouch. Avoided. And they're canceling local shows, too, like Nailed It! México because the dubbed U S version was, um, three times more popular?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And even *Kingdom*, their big Korean zombie series, was their least successful Season One show in Korea.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And even Kingdom, their big Korean zombie series, was their least successful Season One show in Korea.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And Ted Sarandos, their Chief Content Officer, he just flat out said their worst 10 shows are *all* Netflix originals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And Ted Sarandos, their Chief Content Officer, he just flat out said their worst ten shows are all Netflix originals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, his quote was, "increasingly our business is about cancelling and telling bad stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix." Not exactly a ringing endorsement, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, his quote was, increasingly our business is about cancelling and telling bad stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix. Not exactly a ringing endorsement, is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So increasingly our business is about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. That's a rough read for Netflix fans, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. That's a rough read for Netflix fans, for sure.
